poem:
### Contraband Pilgrimage

Wet with more  
than rain, they tread  
paths of ancient  
devotion, cloaking  
their journey in  
sacred guise. Compostela's  
stars fail to sanctify;  
beneath the shells,  
cargo of darkness  
lurks. Along these  
worn stones, witness  
now a pilgrimage  
in reverse – toward the  
unholy end where  
weights are measured  
not in grace  
but grams.
